    • provision

      void provision(@NonNull String tokenName, @NonNull String registrationCode, @NonNull CapSettings capSettings, @NonNull CapTokenDeviceCreationCallback callback)
      Provision CapTokenDevice with the given name, registration code and the CapSettings. The settings are persisted and will be used by OTP generation.

      NOTE:

      • All optional settings (e.g. fingerprint source) will be reset after this call.
      • If CapMobileProtector.Builder.withProtectorRootPolicy(MobileProtector.RootPolicy) is configured to not MobileProtector.RootPolicy.IGNORE and the device is detected as Rooted, a runtime exception com.gemalto.idp.mobile.core.root.RootPolicyException will be thrown
      Parameters:
      tokenName - The TokenDevice name
      registrationCode - The registration code.
      • For MobileProtector.ProvisioningProtocol.PROTOCOL_V3, 2 <= registration code length <= 14
      • For MobileProtector.ProvisioningProtocol.PROTOCOL_V5, 6 <= registration code length <= 32
      capSettings - The Cap settings are persisted and will be used later by OTP generation..
      callback - The callback when provision succeeds or fails.

    • getTokenDeviceNames

      @NonNull Set<String> getTokenDeviceNames() throws FastTrackException
      Retrieve the Set of names of existing CapTokenDevice from the database.
      Returns:
      The collection of available token names
      Throws:
      FastTrackException - when there is a failure reading the database.

    • removeTokenDevice

      boolean removeTokenDevice(@NonNull String tokenName) throws FastTrackException
      Remove CapTokenDevice from the database with given name.
      Parameters:
      tokenName - The TokenDevice name
      Throws:
      FastTrackException - when there is a failure on storage operations.

    • getTokenDevice

      @Nullable CapTokenDevice getTokenDevice(@NonNull String tokenName, @Nullable byte[] customFingerprintData) throws FastTrackException
      Get CapTokenDevice from the database with the given name.
      Parameters:
      tokenName - The TokenDevice name
      customFingerprintData - [Optional] The custom fingerprint data
      Returns:
      The token device. Null is returned if it does not exist
      Throws:
      FastTrackException - If the error happens, possible result code:
      • FastTrackException.DEVICE_FINGERPRINT if the fingerprint is not matched, e.g. the custom fingerprint data is different to the one enrolled
      • FastTrackException.OTP_SETTINGS_NOT_FOUND if the token is provisioned using the Core API (Mobile Protector SDK). persistCapSettings(String, CapSettings) must be invoked in this case
      • FastTrackException.INTERNAL_ERROR for any other error
      • If CapMobileProtector.Builder.withProtectorRootPolicy(MobileProtector.RootPolicy) is configured to not MobileProtector.RootPolicy.IGNORE and the device is detected as Rooted, a runtime exception com.gemalto.idp.mobile.core.root.RootPolicyException will be thrown

    • getTokenDevice

      @Nullable CapTokenDevice getTokenDevice(@NonNull String tokenName, @Nullable byte[] customFingerprintData, @NonNull CapSettings capSettings) throws FastTrackException
      Get CapTokenDevice from the database with the given name.
      Parameters:
      tokenName - The TokenDevice name
      customFingerprintData - [Optional] The custom fingerprint data
      capSettings - The CAP OTP settings should be the same as the policy on the authentication server.
      Returns:
      The token device. Null is returned if it does not exist
      Throws:
      FastTrackException - If the error happens, possible result code:
      • FastTrackException.DEVICE_FINGERPRINT if the fingerprint is not matched, e.g. the custom fingerprint data is different to the one enrolled
      • FastTrackException.INTERNAL_ERROR for any other error
      • If CapMobileProtector.Builder.withProtectorRootPolicy(MobileProtector.RootPolicy) is configured to not MobileProtector.RootPolicy.IGNORE and the device is detected as Rooted, a runtime exception com.gemalto.idp.mobile.core.root.RootPolicyException will be thrown
      Since:
      6.0

    • getTokenDeviceWithUserTokenId

      @Nullable CapTokenDevice getTokenDeviceWithUserTokenId(int userTokenId, @Nullable byte[] customFingerprintData) throws FastTrackException
      Get CapTokenDevice from the database with the given user token Id.
      Parameters:
      userTokenId - The User token Id
      customFingerprintData - [Optional] The custom fingerprint data
      Returns:
      The token device. Null is returned if it does not exist
      Throws:
      FastTrackException - If the error happens, possible result code:
      • FastTrackException.DEVICE_FINGERPRINT if the fingerprint is not matched, e.g. the custom fingerprint data is different to the one enrolled
      • FastTrackException.OTP_SETTINGS_NOT_FOUND if the token is provisioned using the Core API (Mobile Protector SDK). persistCapSettings(String, CapSettings) must be invoked in this case
      • FastTrackException.INTERNAL_ERROR for any other error

    • getTokenDeviceWithUserTokenId

      @Nullable CapTokenDevice getTokenDeviceWithUserTokenId(int userTokenId, @Nullable byte[] customFingerprintData, @NonNull CapSettings capSettings) throws FastTrackException
      Get CapTokenDevice from the database with then given user token Id.
      Parameters:
      userTokenId - The User token Id
      customFingerprintData - [Optional] The custom fingerprint data
      capSettings - The CAP OTP settings should be the same as the policy on the authentication server.
      Returns:
      The token device. Null is returned if it does not exist
      Throws:
      FastTrackException - If the error happens, possible result code:
      • FastTrackException.DEVICE_FINGERPRINT if the fingerprint is not matched, e.g. the custom fingerprint data is different to the one enrolled
      • FastTrackException.INTERNAL_ERROR for any other error
      • If CapMobileProtector.Builder.withProtectorRootPolicy(MobileProtector.RootPolicy) is configured to not MobileProtector.RootPolicy.IGNORE and the device is detected as Rooted, a runtime exception com.gemalto.idp.mobile.core.root.RootPolicyException will be thrown
      Since:
      6.0

    • persistCapSettings

      @Deprecated boolean persistCapSettings(@NonNull String tokenName, @NonNull CapSettings capSettings)
      Deprecated.
      Will be removed in future major release, the replacement function getTokenDevice(String, byte[], CapSettings).
      Store the previously used CapSettings into storage so it can be used later during otp generation. Only useful when upgrading from previous version of Mobile Protector SDK.
      Parameters:
      tokenName - The TokenDevice name
      capSettings - The Cap settings
      Returns:
      true if the setting is saved otherwise false
